title: Predictive Maintenance of Armoured Vehicles using Machine Learning Approaches. (arXiv:2307.14453v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Armoured vehicles are specialized and complex pieces of machinery designed to operate in high-stress environments, often in combat or tactical situations. This study proposes a predictive maintenance-based ensemble system that aids in predicting potential maintenance needs based on sensor data collected from these vehicles. The proposed model's architecture involves various models such as Light Gradient Boosting, Random Forest, Decision Tree, Extra Tree Classifier and Gradient Boosting to predict the maintenance requirements of the vehicles accurately. In addition, K-fold cross validation, along with TOPSIS analysis, is employed to evaluate the proposed ensemble model's stability. The results indicate that the proposed system achieves an accuracy of 98.93%, precision of 99.80% and recall of 99.03%. tldr: 本研究提出了一种基于机器学习的预测性维护系统，通过分析传感器数据预测装甲车辆的维护需求，结果表明系统具有高准确率和稳定性。这种方法有助于减少车辆停机时间，提高运营效率。
en_tdlr: This study proposes a machine learning-based predictive maintenance system that accurately predicts the maintenance needs of armored vehicles using sensor data, achieving high accuracy and stability. This approach helps to reduce vehicle downtime and improve operational efficiency.
